articles.title: Dead Cells developer forced to raise prices due to abuse of Steam PC's regional pricing structure
articles.description: Dead Cells developer Motion Twin has announced that it has been forced to raise the price of Dead Cells in Argentina and Turkey due to players "region hopping" and purchasing the game at a lower price
articles.content:
What you need to know
Dead Cells developer Motion Twin says it had to raise the price of the game in Argentina and Turkey due to users abusing Steam's regional pricing structure.
Regional pricing allows developers to scale the cost of their games dow... [3327 chars]

articles.title: Argentina secures $740 million in loans from development bank
articles.description: Another $100 million will go toward an anti-hunger plan that the ministry said would benefit more than 2.4 million Argentines. The ministry said the remaining $300 million will be split between funding the fight against climate change, the recovery and development of agricultural exports, and improvements in school infrastructure and roads.
articles.content: Argentine Economy Minister Sergio Massa signed an agreement with the Development Bank of Latin America (CAF) for six loans worth $740 million on Friday, the Economy Ministry said in a statement, as Argentina tries to reverse a severe fiscal deficit a... [1168 chars]

articles.title: WATCH: Paddleboarders' Encounter With a Pod of 12 Whales in Argentina Goes Viral
articles.description: The footage captured by the paddleboarders sees them balancing their boards as they push water with the help of their oars.
articles.content: The video of two paddleboarders’ encounter with whales off the coast of Monte Hermoso in Argentina has gone viral on the internet. The event is reported to have taken place on Tuesday, August 16. The footage of their exploit was recorded in what appe... [1977 chars]

articles.title: Placido Domingo Linked to Sex Trafficking Investigation in Argentina
articles.description: Opera star Placido Domingo’s name has appeared in an investigation of a sect-like organization in Argentina that also had U.S. offices and whose leaders have been charged with crimes, including sexual exploitation.
